content:
Diagnosis:	Adenoid cystic carcinoma of right parotid gland

Management:	12 Jan 2024 Right total parotidectomy with facial nerve preservation

Histology:	pT3N0M0 adenoid cystic carcinoma, perineural invasion present, NTRK fusion positive

Current Situation:	Cycle 3 Larotrectinib

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the head and neck oncology clinic. She is tolerating the Larotrectinib well with only grade 1 fatigue and mild nausea which is controlled with PRN ondansetron. Her facial nerve function remains intact with no evidence of weakness. The surgical site has healed well with no signs of local recurrence. Her weight is stable at 68kg.

Blood tests show stable liver function and full blood count. The latest MRI neck from 15 March 2024 shows no evidence of local recurrence or nodal disease. Given the good tolerability and radiological response, we will continue with the current dose of Larotrectinib 100mg twice daily.

Plan is to continue current treatment with review in 4 weeks. Next MRI scan due in 2 months.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: adenoid cystic carcinoma with perineural invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Right total parotidectomy with facial nerve preservation
MRI neck shows no evidence of local recurrence or nodal disease

patient_facts.value: Grade 1 fatigue and mild nausea controlled with PRN ondansetron
Intact facial nerve function with no weakness
Well-healed surgical site with no signs of local recurrence
Stable liver function and full blood count

status_updates.value: Post-operative adenoid cystic carcinoma of parotid on targeted therapy with Larotrectinib. Good treatment response with stable disease on imaging and acceptable tolerability
Grade 1 fatigue and mild nausea managed with antiemetics
Review in head and neck oncology clinic in 4 weeks
